name: Nordic Sea Hotel

reviews.text: Due to a scheduling problem, we had an extra night in Stockholm and our hotel didn't have a room for the night. So on short notice, we found an Economy room at the Nordic Sea Hotel for one night. The economy room is tiny. The bunk beds are a little ridiculous. It is very claustrophobic to have no window.
reviews.title: Tiny room was overpriced and not clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of this was explained in the advertised rate, so I guess I can't really complain. I am generally a low maintenance person, so I thought it would be ok. But it wasn't.
reviews.title: In the City Center - Second time here & will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and the linens were clean. But the floor was covered in hair. Literally covered! It looked like someone just had a haircut in the room and it wasn't swept.
reviews.title: Average hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: Overall, it was not a terrible experience but given how much we paid (nearly $200 USD) I expected much better.
reviews.title: Not a good experience

reviews.text: I didn't enjoy the area of town either. It was conveniently right near the main train station, but it was so busy with tourists , fast food, and cars. Our second hotel in Stockholm was in the very quaint Ostermalm district which was much better.
reviews.title: good location and service but expensive

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for only one night, on a business trip. First, I arrived with the Arlanda express from the Airport, and you the hotel is just opposite the platform in 20 meters walking distance. Reception is friendly and very efficient. The rooms are practical and contain everything you need, including ironing board and coffeemaker, though not spacious. The style is typical Scandinavian, e.g. much wood. redundant. Everything clean and in good condition. Bed comfortable and room quiet. Television has bbc and cnn. Breakfast buffet was tasty, sufficient variety. Check-out was very efficient, but still friendly.
reviews.title: Excellant Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived by train and found it a little hard to locate. Go to the airport train platform, the hotel is 20metres away! Ideal for rail and air passengers. We moved our stay by a day and confirmed by phone, thinking they understood. Unfortunately they had cancelled instead. Thankfully, they found us the last room even though on the second night they were overbooked, so well done.
reviews.title: Coldest drinks in town

reviews.text: The room was spotless and quiet, big enough but not roomy with the expected fripperies including dressing gowns and slippers.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: The hotel also boasts the world's coldest permanent cocktail lounge, the Ice Bar, though we resisted. English style pub on the main street
reviews.title: Great hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bus to the Silja ferry terminal goes from Western Union past the overbridge.
reviews.title: Great breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed at the Nordic Sea Hotel in September 2011. I read many good reviews on Tripadvisor about the hotel and wanted to stay there. All they had were the Express Room Bunkbed-No Window rooms left. I booked two of them anyways just to stay at the hotel. I was skeptical at first about a room with no windows but it was fine. It felt like you were staying on one of those cruise ship interior rooms. They were small but clean and comfortable. You just have to watch yourself on the top bunkbed because of the low ceiling. We appreciated the plush towels that were placed on the racks in the washrooms each day. The washroom was of average size. The TV was very small and hung from the corner of the wall. There is an impressive aquarium situated in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was plentiful - think IKEA breakfast but with a more variety of foods. We bought the 3-day Stockholm Card which included admission to MANY attractions, the local metro buses and trains and the tour boats. We really enjoyed visiting the various sites in Stockholm.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful stay!

reviews.text: This hotel has the nasty habit of "overbooking". Meaning, you have a reservation and when you arrive the hotel in the evening you don't have a room or you don't have the one you want. In my experience I had to sleep in a "storage room" without any windows. Situation was corrected in the 2nd night and excuses and upgrade were provided but the bad experience prevailed!
reviews.title: Miserable experience

reviews.text: Staying at this hotel is a miserable experience even if it is only for 3 nights. The rooms are tiny, you can find stains everywhere, windows look as if they were never cleaned and even the carpets at the corridor stink! Hotel stuff is helpful but you can find several hotels with good stuff, excellent location, clean and with very enjoyable atmosphere at the same price. i strongly recommend you to avoid this hotel.
reviews.title: Avoid by all means

reviews.text: Arrived mid-morning from the Tallinn Ferry but we were immediately allocated a room. Reception staff well above the average and up for making (complimentary!) jokes about my passport photo! Room was very clean, quiet and well equipped - the Hastens beds are a big plus! I was looking forward to the excellent breakfast but was very disappointed that the 'hot' food was all very cold - they need to sort this out - other Stockholm hotels have recently gone for hot-plates which work very well.
reviews.title: Flying Scotsman52

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night and whereas the location was fantastic (walking distance to the old town), the hotel itself was a bit of a let down. When making the booking I was asked if I wanted a room with or without a window (for a relatively new hotel I was surprised some rooms don't have windows - definitely opt for one with!); the room was very small and got quite warm during the night. The hotel bar closed what seemed very early to us (around 10.30pm). The hotel is in a great location for the Arlanda Express train stop so for those needing an early start it's ideal.
reviews.title: Great location - not overly impressed with the room

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the closest to the Arlanda Airport Express stop. For Stockhom the price was reasonable for the standard room. Our room was on 5th floor and my parents was on the 4th. Both were very quiet and clean. Hotel staff helped out with dining recommendations and directions around town. As noted by others a short walk to old town area.
reviews.title: Great Location Standard Room OK

reviews.text: I stayed in a twin room with a window. The room was spacious and clean albeit I can hear my neighbors occasionally. The breakfast spread was good. And the hotel was less than 50m away from the central station. Slightly pricey but likely the norm for Scandinavian countries.
reviews.title: Convenient Location & Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many positives about this hotel
reviews.title: Very very good

reviews.text: Room was excellent in particular the bath room. Great service that included laying on sandwhiches as we were leaving early in the morning to catch a flight home. Its not that far from the old town ( a ten minute walk) close to shops and overall I thought it was very good
reviews.title: Great location, great staff, great restaurant

reviews.text: We stayed here over the New Year's holiday and had a fabulous time. The Ice Bar was very cool but as the night went on, the crowd got younger and younger and the bar area and lobby and other hotel bar got very crowded with the Ice Bar's fallout. Our room was small and not particularly bad or good, just cean and functional. The hotel is old and the rooms could use some freshening up. The food in the restaurant was good and the atmosphere was relaxing. There are computers downstairs for guest use. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Old Town is a short beautiful walk away. The hotel entrance is only steps away from an Arlanda Express stop, however, if your plane leaves early in the morning and you have to catch the train at 4am as we did, this entrance to the train station is not open and you have to walk to a different entrance. This is very important to know in advance if you are dragging your luggage in deep snow in the cold, hurrying to catch a train! All in all, I would definitely stay here again. Great location, bar, food, staff and an acceptable room.
reviews.title: Location is great, rooms okay

description: Nordic Sea Hotel offers you the key to Stockholm. You'll find us in the city centre, right by the Central Station and Arlanda Airport Express train. The city's major attractions are within walking distance. We offer 367 rooms with a modern design inspired by the waters of Stockholm, providing you with all the service you expect, plus that little bit extra. Stockholm's coolest bar: Absolut Icebar Stockholm is also located at Nordic Sea Hotel.
